variants.Description in input context: Ala to Pro substitution at codon 30 [A30P]

Material used.Description: 100×10³ undifferentiated PC12/TetOn cells were seeded in a 96 - well plate.

Readout description.Result Description: Used to assess cell viability. Oxidative treatment was toxic to uninduced cells, with a reduction of viability of about 50% in comparison with control. When exposed to doxycycline 0.1 μg/ml before oxidative challenge, a significant increase of cell viability was assessed. No difference was detectable between α - syn(WT) and (A30P) in this situation. No toxicity was recorded even at 96 h when strongly inducing α - syn expression with 1 μg/ml doxycycline, and this situation was the same for the WT and the mutated form. In PC12/TetOn cells expressing α - syn(WT), inhibition of macroautophagy led to an increase of cell toxicity, and the effect was stronger at doxycycline 1 μg/ml. In PC12/TetOn cells expressing the mutated A30P, a weak decrease of cell viability at doxycycline 1 μg/ml was detected.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One - way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post - hoc test was used to analyze data, and significant differences were marked as *: P < 0.05; **: P < 0.01

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cell viability similar to non - treated control cells

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Cell viability significantly lower than non - treated control cells (e.g., reduction by 50% as observed in some cases)

Material used.Description: 100×10³ undifferentiated PC12/TetOn cells were seeded in a 96 - well plate.

Readout description.Result Description: Used to confirm cell viability results obtained by MTT assay. Data not shown regarding specific results for variants.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: LDH release similar to non - treated control cells

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: LDH release significantly higher than non - treated control cells

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Thioflavin - T binding assay for amyloid aggregate detection

Material used.Description: Cells (about 50×10³) were cultured on poly - D - lysine - coated glass coverslips.

Readout description.Result Description: Used to detect amyloid aggregates. No difference between control and induced cells was found when staining cells expressing α - syn(WT) or (A30P) with thioflavin - T after strong induction of α - syn expression with 1 μg/ml doxycycline. After treatment with doxycycline 1 μg/ml and 3 - MA in α - syn(WT) expressing cells, thioflavin - T staining did not show evidence of insoluble α - syn(WT) fibrils.

Material used.Description: Cellular total protein extracts from PC12/TetOn cells were used.

Readout description.Result Description: Used to analyze α - syn expression levels. A positive correlation between doxycycline amount and α - syn protein expression level was found. In PC12/TetOn cells transfected by an empty pBI - G vector, the basal level of α - syn was negligible and was not affected by doxycycline addition. In PC12/TetOn cells expressing α - syn(WT), the inhibition of macroautophagy, but not the proteasome, led to an accumulation of the protein. In PC12/TetOn cells expressing the mutated A30P, both 3 - MA and MG132 induced protein accumulation but to a smaller extent than in the WT line.

Biological replicates.Description: Densitometric analysis of three independent Western blot experiments or assays was performed.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One - way ANOVA followed by Tukey's post - hoc test was used to analyze data, and significant differences were marked as *: P < 0.05; **: P < 0.01

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: α - syn expression level similar to non - treated control cells (basal level)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: α - syn expression level significantly higher or lower than non - treated control cells

Material used.Description: Cells (50×10³) were cultured on poly - D - lysine - coated chamber slides.

Readout description.Result Description: Used to detect α - syn immunoreactivity. We were able to detect a cytoplasmic increase of α - syn (both WT and A30P) after exposure to 1 μg/ml doxycycline for 48 h. Also used to evaluate macroautophagy activation by LC3 - II immunoreactivity. Macroautophagy activation was noticed in serum - starved and doxycycline - induced cells, with a stronger reactivity for the α - syn(WT) form in comparison with the mutated A30P.

Basic positive control.Description: Mock - transfected PC12/TetOn cells cultured in absence of serum for 18 h were used as a positive control for macroautophagy activation (CT +).

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: No significant change in immunoreactivity compared to non - treated control cells

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant change in immunoreactivity compared to non - treated control cells
